Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ipa-admintools
exit 0

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ipa-client
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: ipa bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The ipa packages have been upgraded to upstream version 4.2.0. For detailed information about 4.2.0, see the release notes linked to from the References section. (BZ#1204809) The following enhancements are described in more detail in the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 Release Notes, linked to from the References section: One-way trusts are now supported, and IdM server is a trust agent by default (BZ#1145748, BZ#1206613) Multiple certificate profiles (BZ#1200694) Password Vault (BZ#1204501) Kerberos HTTPS proxy in IdM (BZ#1206534) Negotiate authentication streamlined with mod_auth_gssapi (BZ#1200883) User life-cycle management capabilities and managing IdM users directly from a standard LDAP client (BZ#1199530, BZ#989091) Issuing certificates for user accounts (BZ#1200735) Automated migration from WinSync to trusts (BZ#1204205) Browser and documentation for the JSON-RPC API available as Technology Preview (BZ#846033) DNSSEC available as Technology Preview (BZ#1115294) Apache modules for IdM, previously Technology Preview, are now fully supported Notable bug fixes: When using the extdom plug-in to handle large groups, user and group lookups previously failed due to insufficient buffer size. The problem no longer occurs. (BZ#1193759) An attempt to install an IdM server previously failed with the following error message in certain situations: ipalib.errors.LDAPError: failed to decode certificate: (SEC_ERROR_INVALID_ARGS) security library: invalid arguments. The source code handling Certificate Authority (CA) certificates during installation has been updated to fix the problem. The error message no longer appears, and the installation completes successfully. (BZ#1194312) Several bugs related to the Network Time Protocol (NTP) in IdM have been fixed. (BZ#1196656, BZ#1211708, BZ#1215197, BZ#1215200) Command-line and web UI operations involving large groups (for example, groups with 15,000 users) were very slow. The problem sometimes caused commands such as "ipa group-show" to time out. Now, IdM handles such operations faster. (BZ#1204637) Several bugs related to using the "ipa trust-add" command have been fixed. (BZ#1216935, BZ#1222047, BZ#1249455) Users without admin privileges were previously not allowed to perform certain search operations, such as "ipa zone-find", "ipa hbacrule-find", or "ipa host-find". With this update, non-admin users can successfully perform these search operations as expected. (BZ#1243261, BZ#1246141, BZ#1248524) Features: The "ipa migrate-ds" command now supports different search scopes. The user can specify LDAP search depth for users and groups by adding the "--scope" option, which accepts the "base", "onelevel", or "subtree" values. (BZ#805188) It is now possible to map identity certificates from smart cards to user entries in IdM, which improves the centralized authentication functionality. (BZ#1072383) This update introduces the "ipa-server-upgrade" utility. The utility automatically upgrades the current IdM server installation. (BZ#1199520) Requesting a certificate during IdM client kickstart enrollment no longer requires certmonger to be running. It is possible to successfully request a certificate in the described situation without certmonger, on the condition that the D-Bus daemon is not running. To use this functionality, set the system bus address to "/dev/null" for the ipa-client-install utility in the kickstart chroot environment: # env DBUS_SYSTEM_BUS_ADDRESS=unix:path=/dev/null ipa-client-install Note that the certmonger service requires a system reboot to start monitoring the certificate obtained in this way. (BZ#1234919) The instructions on the IdM web UI browser configuration page have been updated to reflect recent changes to the Mozilla Firefox extension signing policies. (BZ#1261074) Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
